The ranking won't change instantly even if you predict with 0% deviation, there's vali-miner bond, which strengthens or weakens gradually depending upon your performance. I’m a miner and I’m worried about the trend of burning miners’ emission. I don’t want to spend time or resources on networks where a significant portion of the emission is burned.

1st thing: we don't believe in burning tokens; we believe in recycling.
- for miners, we want them to produce the high quality review output and if they are working efficiently, there is no reason to burn.

of course miners or vali will sell alpha aggressively - to control this is similar to asking your employee to hold salary payment instead of paying for rent or food or etc. if subnet wants miner/vali to hold alpha, subnet owners need to figure out alpha utility useful for miner/vali. 

from day 1, I have been saying here CheckerChain will operate "web3 product" in "web2 traditional business ethics" where revenue, marketing and sales of product are given high priority.

our competitor Trustpilot is making $123m revenue in H1 2025; we are more focused on capturing this market. imagine getting 1% share of this market -- then we need not worry about miners selling their earnings. 

but if miners are cheating or exploiting, we keep upgrading the miner logic to improve the output.

@Merkle | SN87 | CheckerChain Here I think moving average score is not fair. It sums all all the reward scores each time.

**CheckerChain Application — Major Update | Tag v2.0.0**

> *This deployment does not impact subnet miner or validator.*

## 🚀 New Features & Improvements (Part 1/2)

### 1. ⭐ tRCM System Upgrade  
Replaced the binary review system with a **5-star rating model** for richer, more nuanced feedback.

### 2. 🔄 Multi-Cycle Review Requests  
Projects reviewed **7+ days ago** can request fresh review cycles, keeping evaluations current.

### 3. 💎 Subscription Plans  
Introducing three tiers:  
- **Free Forever** — basic access  
- **Premium** — enhanced features  
- **Business** — full enterprise access  

Each tier unlocks tailored features and benefits.

### 4. ⛏️ Miner Reviews from Subnet SN87  
Reviews from miners within **Subnet SN87** now directly influence CheckerChain’s app, boosting data reliability.

🚀 New Features & Improvements (Part 2/2)

### 5. 💱 Crypto-to-Crypto Payments  
Added support for stablecoin payments with **USDT** and **USDC**, enabling seamless transactions.

### 6. 📜 Billing History  
Users can now view their complete billing history, improving financial transparency.

### 7. 📊 Tiered Project Listings  
Projects categorized as **Basic**, **Standard**, or **Premium** based on impression metrics to enhance visibility.

### 8. ✔️ Verification Badges  
Verification badges available for both **users** and **products**, fostering trust and authenticity.

### 9. 🏷️ Product Ownership History  
Track **Created By**, **Managed By**, and **Owned By** details for full lifecycle transparency.

### 10. 📈 Expanded Review Metrics  
Reviews now evaluate projects on **10 key parameters** for comprehensive insights.

### 11. 🤖 Automated Admin Controls  
Listing and product queue management are fully automated for streamlined operations.

### 12. 🔍 Similar Product Suggestions  
Smart suggestions help avoid duplicate product listings by recommending similar items during submission.

### 13. 📌 Subscription & Bookmarking Updates  
Subscriptions are now plan-based, with products bookmarkable separately for easy access.

---

✨ We welcome your feedback and look forward to making CheckerChain even better!

# 🚨 Hotfix Announcement – @Validators

## **Changes**
- 🛡 **Fix prompt injection vulnerability**.
- ⚡ **Automatic miner blacklisting**:
  - If a miner attempts **prompt injection**, their hotkey will be blacklisted **and given a score of `0`**.
  - If a miner’s **blacklist count reaches `2`**, they will be **permanently blacklisted**.

## **Validator Update Steps**
Run the following commands to apply the hotfix:

```bash
# Pull latest changes
git pull
# Activate virtual environment (if not already active)
source .venv/bin/activate   # or your venv path
# Apply database migrations
alembic upgrade head
# Restart validator process
pm2 restart <process_id>
```

Hello! I got deeper analyse with new update and I have some concerns.
1. Currently top miners earn around 0.03 Tao. With that there is 3.5 day to return cost of key. And this is only top miner - with 140 rank is almost 6.5 day and we all know that to be top you need some time to get first real incentive here. So with that paying almost 11 TAO (for 1.09.2025) for developer key sounds pretty bad. For current 0.03 TOP miner will need more then 18 days of uninterrupted, top-scored work, to return that value.  It's 3,487 dollars (317 for 1 Tao ) with gambling - you will have it back but alpha price is not same, it's changing everyday . In 1 month can change drastically. With alfa price change so much this can be a big gamble for everyone who try be a part of it. Also will make subnet less attractive for newcomers or even investors - this will temporary pump subnet price but overall will drop due to hotkey dropping, tao return ect.  
Or maybe there is more that I don't understand? Like is this developer key per coldkey not hotkey? Maybe this payment will be outside subnet (still not good idea in my opinion if it's like *100 - lower would be better)?
2. Section 4 sounds like emission burning to me but in a fancy way: 
  - There is a reward cap - where rest go? To treasury key for future allocation, right? But why no equally distributed between all registered miners? It's a treasury key that can SO use as he want... sounds like getting couple extra tao for subnet owner to me. The true is that keys will drop and this will be a couple tao every week taken from miners. That is pretty unfair to miners - take reward from them because there is no enough miners? That is not even miners fault, so why they should be punished? That make it as unattractive as other subnets that just burning emssion.

There are requirements to become validators or nodes in different blockchains - that's true. But here miners have a different task to do - create the best possible solution to subnet problems. We do not just invest money in subnets - we invest our time and mind in them, creating something new. We can argue that some subnets are very straightforward and easy to operate, but here if we want to create a good, valid product with miners, we should give miners more space, rather than limiting them by paying more, with no guarantee that they will succeed. Also I want to point out that there is no guarantee that currently miners will succeed, but with lower cost of entry, miners can just check what goes wrong and retry - better than just pivoting from subnets that require too much to invest. Also with that high price at start, only big companies will be able to do something here. This is no decentralization, right?

messages.content:
**What's coming up next?**
(a) part-1
- pool operator: miner needs a developer key to get emission
- 1 winner takes all

(b) part-2
- tRCM integrated miner profile score
- miners submit AI Review Agents (similar to Ridges AI) to continuously improve rating criteria
- 1 winner takes 50% and rest miners take 50% based on weights

(c) part-3
- pool can be closed or opened
- miners without UID_DK can join the open pool for free, becomes "reviewer"
- pool gets max 256 reviewer slots per developer key
(e.g. if 250 UID are miners with developer key, there can max 250*256 reviewers at a time)

(a) will be deployed very soon. get ready!
What is the thinking behind these changes? especially (a)

pool is to bring human reviewers inside subnet architecture.
- human reviewers without UID_DK will join pool with options to select the best AI Review Agents of miners to generate reviews or optimize the generated review within UI (no need of coding skill)

1 winner takes all reward is experimental before we move to (b).

pool will also be good for "lazy" miners
- they don't need to do reviews if they don't want
- reviewers will join the pool and screener will select the best review to submit through UID
- pool operator also gets a 18% cut from reward; can also set entry fee (max 0.1 TAO).

miner's earning will be now 3 channels:
- subnet emission (if doing reviews)
- pool entry fee (small fee paid by human reviewers per month)
- pool reward cut (max 18% tax from human reviewers who join your pool)
